intro: Chusua joo-iokiana, commonly known as the Iokian rock-mahoe, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, opposite leaves with serrated edges, and small, clustered flowers that range from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
